chapter.p: 1The oracle of Babylon that Isaiah son of Amoz saw:

ul.li1: 2Raise a signal on a bare hill,
ul.li2: lift up your voice to them;
wave the hand and may they enter the gateways of the noblemen.
ul.li1: 3I myself I have commanded my consecrated ones,
ul.li2: I have also summoned my mighty warriors concerning my anger,
the ones who exalt overLiterally “exultant of” my majesty.
ul.li1: 4A sound, a noise is on the mountains,
ul.li2: the likeness of many people!
ul.li1: A sound of the roar of the kingdoms,
ul.li2: of nations gathering!
ul.li1: Yahweh of hosts is mustering an army for battle.
5They are coming from a distant land,
ul.li2: from the end of the heavens,
ul.li1: Yahweh and the weapons of his indignation,
ul.li2: to destroy the whole earth.Literally “all of the land/earth”
ul.li1: 6Wail, for the day of Yahweh is near;
ul.li2: it will come like destruction from Shaddai!Often translated “the Almighty”
ul.li1: 7Therefore all hands will grow slack,
ul.li2: and every human heart will melt,
8and they will be dismayed.
ul.li1: Pangs and labor pains will seize them;
ul.li2: they will tremble like a woman giving birth.
ul.li1: They will stare at one another,Literally “A man will stare at his neighbor”
ul.li2: their faces flushing.Literally “faces of flames”
ul.li1: 9Look! The day of Yahweh is coming,
ul.li2: cruel and wrath and the burning of anger,
ul.li1: to make the earth a desolation,
ul.li2: and he will destroy its sinners from it.
ul.li1: 10For the stars of the heavens and their constellations will not flash forth their light;
ul.li2: the sun will keep back when it comes out,
and the moon will not cause its light to shine.
ul.li1: 11And I will punish the world for its evil
ul.li2: and the wicked for their iniquity.
ul.li1: And I will put an end to the pride of the arrogant,
ul.li2: and I will bring the haughtiness of tyrants low.
ul.li1: 12I will make humanity more rare than gold
ul.li2: and humankind more than the gold of Ophir.
ul.li1: 13Therefore I will make the heavens tremble,
ul.li2: and the earth will quake from its place
ul.li1: because of the wrath of Yahweh of hosts,
ul.li2: and in the day his anger burns.

ul.li1: like a hunted gazelle or sheep with none to gather them,Literally “and without one who gathers”
they will each turn to his own people,
ul.li2: and they will each flee to his own land.
ul.li1: 15Everyone who is found will be pierced through,
ul.li2: and everyone who is carried away will fall by the sword.
ul.li1: 16And their children will be dashed into pieces before their eyes;
ul.li2: their houses will be plundered, and their wives will be raped.The reading tradition (Qere) softens this to “slept with”
ul.li1: 17Look! I am stirring the Medes up against them,
who do not value silver
ul.li2: and do not delight in gold.
ul.li1: 18And their bows will shatter young men.
ul.li2: And they will not show mercy on the fruit of the womb;
their eyes will not look compassionately on children.

chapter.p: 19And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the splendor of the Chaldeans’ pride, will be like when God overthrewLiterally “the overthrow by God of” Sodom and Gomorrah.

ul.li1: 20It will not be inhabited forever,
ul.li2: and it will not be dwelled in forever;Literally “until generation and generation”
ul.li1: and no Arab will pitch a tent there,
ul.li2: and shepherds will not allow their flocks to lie down there.
ul.li1: 21But wild animals will lie down there,
ul.li2: and their houses will be full of howling creatures,
ul.li1: and the daughters of ostrichesHebrew “ostrich” will live there,
ul.li2: and goats will dance there.
ul.li1: 22And hyenas will answer in its palaces,
ul.li2: and jackals in the pleasure palaces;
ul.li1: and its time is coming soon,Literally “close to come”
ul.li2: and its days will not be prolonged.
